STEWARTSVILLE ELEMENTARY INCIDENT

This morning, an employee found a shotgun shell on the floor of the Stewartsville Elementary School cafeteria.

The employee immediately notified the building principal, who began an immediate investigation following established school safety procedures. The investigation will do everything possible to determine the source of the shell.

Building administration is working in consultation with North Huntingdon Township Police Department, the Westmoreland County Department of Public Safety, and the Norwin Central Office Administration. The building is being thoroughly searched, including the use of the Westmoreland County ballistics detection canine. The investigation is ongoing; however, it is believed there is no credible threat to students.

Rest assured, the administration will continue with what is in the best interest of the general welfare and safety of all students and staff.
